subNodes.conversationText: root
"Mortal, you have returned! Is the deed done?"
"Yes. The Vandrid is dead."
"Wonderful! I knew you could do it." The imp practically capers with glee. "And I see you have your soul, as well. We both win!"
"What will you do?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"I can't let you keep the Elderin souls. They must be released."
"That was not a part of our deal!"
"There's plenty of power for you here without the souls. Don't make me angry, imp, I killed the Vandrid and I can kill you easily enough."

The imp licks its lips nervously. "Now, now! There's no need to be hasty. Oh, very well."

The imp shuts its eyes for a moment, and the room grows warmer. You grip your weapons tightly. There is a sudden sound, like boiling steam escaping a pot, and a tremendous flash of light that makes you throw your hand over your eyes. 

And then, it is done. The Crypts feel cold and empty once more, and the distance sounds of screaming have faded to a peaceful silence.

"It is done." The imp says. "The Elderin are free."
"Get out of my sight."

The imp grins. "Well. A wasted opportunity, but nonetheless I think this has been a good partnership indeed. And there is plenty for me to discover in the lost Elderin city. Farewell, mortal, and... good luck with that stone."

It smiles, intones a word, and fades away.
Continue
"Very well."

The imp grins. "Well, hasn't this been a good partnership indeed. Farewell, mortal, and... good luck with that stone."

It smiles, intones a word, and fades away.
Continue
"Mortal, you have returned! Is the deed done?"
"Yes. The Vandrid is dead."
"Wonderful! I knew you could do it." The imp practically capers with glee. "And I see you have your soul, as well. We both win!"
"What will you do?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"I can't let you keep the Elderin souls. They must be released."
"That was not a part of our deal!"
"There's plenty of power for you here without the souls. Don't make me angry, imp, I killed the Vandrid and I can kill you easily enough."

The imp licks its lips nervously. "Now, now! There's no need to be hasty. Oh, very well."

The imp shuts its eyes for a moment, and the room grows warmer. You grip your weapons tightly. There is a sudden sound, like boiling steam escaping a pot, and a tremendous flash of light that makes you throw your hand over your eyes. 

And then, it is done. The Crypts feel cold and empty once more, and the distance sounds of screaming have faded to a peaceful silence.

"It is done." The imp says. "The Elderin are free."
"Get out of my sight."

The imp bows. "Well. A wasted opportunity, but nonetheless I think this has been a good partnership indeed. And there is plenty for me to discover in the lost Elderin city. Farewell, mortal, and...", it grins, "good luck with that stone."

It intones a word, and fades away.
Continue
"Very well."

The imp grins. "Well, hasn't this been a good partnership indeed. Farewell, mortal, and... good luck with that stone."

It smiles, intones a word, and fades away.
Continue
"You lied to me, imp!"

The imp grows still and wary.

"Beware the Vandrid, <FullName>! It is deceitful. What lies has it told you?"
"It told me that the trapped soul in the Elderin Stone merges with the user. They become tainted!"
"What? That's nonsense."
"So it's not true?"

The imp throws up its hands in exasperation.

"Of course it's not bloody true! What, the Great Soul taints the user? Why would the Elderin design their stones to do that? They weren't bloody idiots!"

"Using the stone is the only way to forever get rid of the Vandrid. You must destroy it!"
"Already done. I turned down the Vandrid's offer and killed it."

"Oh, thank the hells! I knew you could do it." The imp breathes a clear sigh of relief. "And now you have your soul, as well. The Vandrid's soul will save your King, I promise you. There is no taint."
"What will you do now?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"Mortal, you have returned! Is the deed done?"
"Yes. The Vandrid is dead."
"Wonderful! I knew you could do it." The imp practically capers with glee. "And you have your Great Soul, as well. We both win!"
"What will you do?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"Very well."

The imp grins. "Well, hasn't this been a good partnership indeed. Farewell, mortal, and... good luck with that stone."

It smiles and makes its way down to the Undertemple, where you know the Vandrid is waiting for it.
Continue
"You lied to me, imp!"

The imp grows still and wary.

"Beware the Vandrid, <FullName>! It is deceitful. What lies has it told you?"
"It told me that the trapped soul in the Elderin Stone merges with the user. They become tainted!"
"What? That's nonsense."
"So it's not true?"

The imp throws up its hands in exasperation.

"Of course it's not bloody true! What, the Great Soul taints the user? Why would the Elderin design their stones to do that? They weren't bloody idiots!"

"Using the stone is the only way to forever get rid of the Vandrid. You must destroy it!"
"The Vandrid has offered me a hero's soul that would make the King a better man."

"In return for me, no doubt? It knows that I plan to destroy it."

The imp's eyes are bright. "I take it that you do not intend to follow through on the offer? Otherwise you would not be telling me. What is it you want?"
"I don't want anything. I will take the inert Elderin Stone back to Serl Dorian."
"But you are so close! You can finally destroy the Vandrid!"
"No. I'm done with the lot of you."

"So be it."

The imp's face contorts into a fierce scowl, and with a bright flash of light it disappears.
Continue
"You will go to the Vandrid. As soon as the hero's soul is in the Elderin Stone, I will rescue you."
"But the hero's soul is worthless to you, I promise. Please, reconsider - destroy the Vandrid as we agreed!"
"I want the King to be healed as a hero, not a tyrant. I will rescue you from the Vandrid as soon as I have that soul."
"Listen to yourself! You're attempting to do a deal with a devil for a hero's soul? Is that really what you have become?"
"Actually... you're right. I want nothing more to do with this."
"Destroy the demon as we orignally agreed. This would be a boon to the mortal world."
"Very well. I will kill this demon."
"There is nothing more important than having a good king. Do as I say."
The imp flaps its wings wretchedly. "If I do this, you will rescue me, yes? You won't leave me with the Vandrid?"
"I've already said that, imp. I will destroy the Vandrid after I get this Great Soul."

The imp's face is in the agony of indecision.

Finally, it nods. "Very well," it grumbles, and descends the stairs to the Undertemple where you know the Vandrid is waiting for it.
Continue
"Back already mortal? Is the deed done?"
"Not yet. I'm working on it."

"You did it! You have the Elderin Stone! And you've killed Azzerakiun." 

Dalamar grins at you. "You have done very well, very well indeed!"
"Whatever you are, you're not Dalamar. Stand back."
"What? What do you mean?"
"I found Dalamar's corpse. What the hell are you, really?"

"Ahhh." The thing calling itself Dalamar's face falls. "You found the corpse."

He pauses, licking his lips. "Yes, of course. I should have hidden it better. Such a shame, really. He seemed almost bearable, for a mortal."

He reflects. "Not really."
"I won't ask again - what the hell are you?"

The creature grins at you, and suddenly his face reddens. You step back in surprise as his body twists and shrinks, wings erupting from his back. His eyes remain bright and full of malice as he transforms into a form that you know only too well.
Continue
"Hello again, <FullName>."
"You're Dalamar?"

"Not really. Dalamar was a hero, I believe. Of sorts. A strange man, really. He thought he would be able to drive Azzerakin out of the crypts and free the Elderin souls." The imp grins. "Total bloody idiot really. Azzerakin had his number from the minute he walked through the main gates."
"So she killed him?"

"No, I killed him. She told me to, of course, but I enjoyed it right enough. He suffered a great deal before I let him die." 

"Now, you and me. We don't have to have that kind of relationship, do we? We still have a shared goal, I think."
"Why did you take his form?"

"Because I knew you'd never trust me if you knew I was an imp! And its always easier to have a recent body to use as a template. I can never get your bloody faces right in the spell unless I'm basing it on someone I've seen recently."
"So what do you want?"
"The same deal. I will tell you how to use the stone, and you will do me a favor."
"No way. I'm not dealing with you."
"But your stone is worthless! I can tell you how to use it!"
"Begone, imp! There will be no bargain!"

The imp's face twists with rage for a moment, and then it fades abruptly from sight. 

Your job is done here. You have the Elderin Stone, and its time to go home. Whatever else was going on in this place is no longer your problem.
Continue
"Very well. I will hear you out, but no promises."

The imp talks quickly, its eyes shining. 

"The Elderin never really mastered the dark magics necessary to extend their lives forever. They came close, but they were deceived. The Elderin Stones are the legacy of their deception."
"Some chance! Your existence ends here!"

The imp's face twists with rage for a moment, and then it fades abruptly from sight. 

Your job is done here. You have the Elderin Stone, and its time to go home. Whatever else was going on in this place is no longer your problem.
"Keep talking, imp."

The imp talks quickly, its eyes shining. 

"The Elderin never really mastered the dark magics necessary to extend their lives forever. They came close, but they were deceived. The Elderin Stones are the legacy of their deception."
"What do you mean?"
"I mean there is a cost. The process of powering an Elderin Stone can only be completed by trapping a Great Soul within it. Creatures with such souls are rare and dangerous."
"So the Elderin Stone is worthless."

"No. Far from it. I have a solution to your problem."

The imp grins. "One that need not rest heavily on your mortal concience."
"I'm listening."

"The Elderin did not flee their city. They were deceived by a great demon, a creature called a Vandrid in your tongue."

"Over a period of a hundred years the Vandrid dripped poison and fear into their ears, until finally they fled the city to build a refuge deep underground. The underground city was to be their solace, but the Vandrid had deceived them. It became their hell. The Vandrid has them trapped down there, even now." 

The imp breathes a sigh of admiration. "Truly, it was marvellous work."
Continue

"The Vandrid is a creature of enormous evil that cannot be fully killed. Even if its body was destroyed, it would only be driven to another astral plane, where it could continue to devise its schemes."

"I want it totally destroyed. And you have the power to do it!"
"How, exactly?"

"You must kill the demon and trap its Great Soul within the Elderin Stone. You could then use this to heal your king and extend his life, and in doing so completely extinguish the demon."

The imp licks its lips. "It could never come back. Never. I would finally have this place all to myself."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"How could we kill an ancient demon? We wouldn't stand a chance."
"No. You're right, of course. But I can help you with this. I have an ancient magic scroll that will weaken the Vandrid sufficiently for you to kill it."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"What was Azzerakin doing here?"

"She had heard of the Vandrid, and she knew of the trapped souls under the temple. This was the perfect place for her to experiment. She did a deal with the demon."

The imp grins. "I bet she's regretting that right now."
"And you were working for her?"
"I was bound to her will. But now you've killed her, that unfortunate situation has become much less complicated."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"Why are you helping me?"

The imp grins. "That's simple. I want the Vandrid destroyed and the souls of the Elderin within my power. There is an immense amount of knowledge in this place, but much of it is held in the Eldrin city deeper underground. Unless the Vandrid is killed I cannot access it."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"Very well. I have no further questions."
"So you will do it? You will kill the Vandrid and consume its soul in the Elderin Stone?"
"I seem to have little choice. I want to save the King with this stone."
"Good, good! You really are a hero, and you will save him, I promise. Here is the scroll to weaken the Vandrid, and a key to the Undertemple. Return when you have completed your task!"
"You'd better not be lying to me, imp."
"I won't bargain with you, imp. We're done here."

The imp's face twists with rage for a moment, and then it fades abruptly from sight. 

Your job is done here. You have the Elderin Stone, and its time to go home. Whatever else was going on in this place is no longer your problem.
"You have returned! Is it done?"
"Yes. The Vandrid is dead."
"Wonderful! I knew you could do it." Dalamar practically capers with glee. "And I see you have your soul, as well. We both win!"
"What will you do?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"You promised to release the Elderin souls!"

"Ah yes. Well, I will do, I will. One day. I just need to study them for a while first. What is another ten years when you have already been trapped for a thousand, eh?"

Dalamar clasps you on the shoulder, and then sets off down into the cavern under the temple.
Continue
"You have returned! Is it done?"
"Yes. The Vandrid is dead."
"Wonderful! I knew you could do it." Dalamar practically capers with glee. "And I see you have your soul, as well. We both win!"
"What will you do?"

"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground." 

His eyes narrow unpleasantly. "Powerful knowledge."
"You promised to release the Elderin souls!"

"Ah yes. Well, I will do, I will. One day. I just need to study them for a while first. What is another ten years when you have already been trapped for a thousand, eh?"

Dalamar clasps you on the shoulder, and then sets off down into the cavern under the temple.
Continue
"You lied to me, Dalamar!"

Dalamar pales.

"Beware the Vandrid, <FullName>! It is deceitful. What lies has it told you?"
"It told me that the trapped soul in the Elderin Stone merges with the user. They become tainted!"
"What? That's nonsense."
"So it's not true?"

"Of course it's not true! What, the Great Soul taints the user? Why would the Elderin design their stones to do that? They weren't idiots!"

"Using the stone is the only way to forever get rid of the Vandrid! You must kill it!"
"Already done. I turned down the Vandrid's offer and killed it."
"Oh, thank the gods! I knew you could do it." Dalamar breathes a clear sigh of relief. "And now you have your soul, as well. The Vandrid's soul will save your King, I promise you. There is no taint."
"What will you do?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"You promised to release the Elderin souls!"

"Ah yes. Well, I will do, I will. One day. I just need to study them for a while first. What is another ten years when you have already been trapped for a thousand, eh?"

Dalamar clasps you on the shoulder and then sets off down into the cavern under the temple.
Continue
"Return when it is done."
Continue
"You have returned! Is it done?"
"Yes. The Vandrid is dead."
"Wonderful! I knew you could do it." Dalamar practically capers with glee. "And now you have your soul, as well. The Vandrid's soul will save your King! We both win!"
"What will you do?"
"Now the Vandrid is dead, I will explore below the temple. There is much hidden knowledge in the city underground."
"You promised to release the Elderin souls!"

"Ah yes. Well, I will do, I will. One day. I just need to study them for a while first. What is another ten years when you have already been trapped for a thousand, eh?"

Dalamar clasps you on the shoulder, and then sets off down into the cavern under the temple, where you know the Vandrid will be waiting for him.
Continue
"No. You lied to me, Dalamar!"

Dalamar pales.

"Beware the Vandrid, <FullName>! It is deceitful. What lies has it told you?"
"It told me that the trapped soul in the Elderin Stone merges with the user. They become tainted!"
"What? That's nonsense."
"So it's not true?"

"Of course it's not true! What, the Great Soul taints the user? Why would the Elderin design their stones to do that? They weren't idiots!"

"Using the stone is the only way to forever get rid of the Vandrid! You must kill it!"
"The Vandrid has offered me a hero's soul that would make the King a better man."

"In return for me, no doubt? It knows that I am a hero looking to drive it away."

Dalamar sighs. "I take it that you do not intend to follow through on the offer? Otherwise you would not be telling me."
"I will not deal with the Vandrid. I will take the inert Elderin Stone back to Serl Dorian."
"But you are so close! You can finally kill this thing!"
"No, Dalamar. I'm done with the lot of you."
Dalamar's face contorts into a fierce and scarcely human scowl, and with a bright flash of light he disappears.
Continue
"You will go to the Vandrid. As soon as I have the hero's soul, I will rescue you."
"But the hero's soul is worthless to you, I promise! Please, reconsider! Go and slay the Vandrid as we agreed!"
"I want that hero's soul! I will rescue you from the Vandrid as soon as I have it."
"Listen to yourself! You're attempting to do a deal with a devil for a hero's soul? Is that really what you have become?"
"You're right. I want nothing more to do with this."
"Kill the demon as we orignally agreed. This would be a boon to the world!"
"I intend to kill the demon."
Dalamar breathes a sigh of relief. "Good, good. Return when the job is done and it is safe to descend."
"I want that soul, Dalamar! You will do as I say!"

"I think not, mortal!"

Dalamar's face contorts into a fierce and scarcely human scowl, and with a quick intonation he fades from sight.
Continue
"I will not deal with the Vandrid. I will take the inert Elderin Stone back to Serl Dorian."
"I intend to kill the demon."
Dalamar breathes a sigh of relief. "Good, good. Return when the job is done and it is safe to descend."
Continue

Dalamar bows. 

"How can I help you?"
"I had some questions."
"What can I do for you?"
"How could we kill an ancient demon? We wouldn't stand a chance."

"No. You're right, of course. But I can help you with this."

"My research in this place led me to the writings of an Elderin mage called Mier Mantis. He alone amongst the Elderin had suspicions about what was happening. He spent years developing a spell that would weaken the demon, stripping it of its resistances and many of its powers. I have found the spell."
Continue
"If you agree to kill the demon, I will give you a scroll. Read it when you are within the demon's presence and strike quickly, before it can recover."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"What was Azzerakiun doing here?"

"She had heard of the Vandrid, and she knew of the trapped souls under the temple. This was the perfect place for her to experiment. She did some kind of deal with the demon."

Dalamar grins. "I bet she's regretting that right now."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"Why are you helping me?"

Dalamar shrugs. "That's simple. I want the Vandrid destroyed and the souls of the Elderin released from their torment. There is an immense amount of knowledge in this place, but much of it is held in the Elderin city deeper underground. Unless the Vandrid is killed I cannot access it."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"Very well. I have no further questions."
"Good luck."
Continue
"I don't need anything from you."

"You did it! You have the Elderin Stone! And you've killed Azzerakin." 

Dalamar grins at you. "You have done very well, very well indeed!"
"You promised to tell me how this stone works."
"Yes, of course!" Dalamar's grin fades slightly. "Although... you're not going to like it."
"Tell me."
"The Elderin never really mastered the dark magics necessary to extend their lives forever. They came close, but they were deceived. The Elderin Stones are the legacy of their deception."
"What do you mean?"
"I mean there is a cost. The process of powering an Elderin Stone can only be completed by trapping a Great Soul within it. Creatures with such souls are rare and dangerous."
"What happens to the soul trapped in the stone?"

"It is consumed in the process, destroying it utterly. The stone's user gets to live again, but the Great Soul is extinguished."

Dalamar sighs. "The magic is completely immoral, of course. A thing of great evil. The Elderin knew this."
"So the Elderin Stone is worthless."
"No. Far from it. I have a solution to your problem. One that will not rest heavily on your concience."
"I'm listening."

"The Elderin did not flee their city. They were deceived by a great demon, a creature called a Vandrid in your tongue."

"Over a period of a hundred years the Vandrid dripped poison and fear into their ears, until finally they fled the city to build a refuge deep underground. The underground city was to be their solace, but the Vandrid had deceived them. It became their hell. The Vandrid has them trapped down there, even now."
Continue

"The Vandrid is a creature of enormous evil that cannot be fully killed. Even if its body was destroyed, it would only be driven to another astral plane, where it could continue to devise its schemes."

"You have the chance to change this!"
"How?"

"You must kill the demon and trap its Great Soul within the Elderin Stone. You could then use this to heal your king and extend his life, and in doing so completely extinguish the demon."

Dalamar licks his lips. "It could never come back. Never. Its malice would finally be at an end."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"How could we kill an ancient demon? We wouldn't stand a chance."

"No. You're right, of course. But I can help you with this."

"My research in this place led me to the writings of an Elderin mage called Mier Mantis. He alone amongst the Elderin had suspicions about what was happening. He spent years developing a spell that would weaken the demon, stripping it of its resistances and many of its powers. I have found the spell."
Continue
"If you agree to kill the demon, I will give you a scroll. Read it when you are within the demon's presence and strike quickly, before it can recover."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"What was Azzerakin doing here?"

"She had heard of the Vandrid, and she knew of the trapped souls under the temple. This was the perfect place for her to experiment. She did some kind of deal with the demon."

Dalamar grins. "I bet she's regretting that right now."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"Why are you helping me?"

Dalamar shrugs. "That's simple. I want the Vandrid destroyed and the souls of the Elderin released from their torment. There is an immense amount of knowledge in this place, but much of it is held in the Eldrin city deeper underground. Unless the Vandrid is killed I cannot access it."
Continue
"I assume you have questions?"
"Very well. I have no further questions."
"So then. What will you do?"
"I have no interest in fighting your demon. I have secured an Elderin Stone, and I will return it in its current state."
"I urge you to think again! The stone is useless without a Great Soul - useless! Your king will die, and the souls of the Elderin will continue in their torment!"
"I don't care. I'm taking this stone and leaving."

For a second, Dalamar's face contorts with inhuman rage, and then he is gone. There is no sound, or disturbance in the air - one second, he is there, and the next he is not. He has simply vanished.

You shake your head and continue.
Continue
"Very well. I will kill this demon and complete the Elderin Stone."
"Good, good! Here is the scroll I promised you, and a key to the Undertemple. Return when you have completed your task!"
"I will kill this demon and complete the Elderin Stone."
"Good, good! Here is the scroll I promised you, and a key to the Undertemple. Return when you have completed your task!"
Continue
